Package fel.cvut.pjv

Class BulletDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • fel.cvut.pjv.BulletDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class BulletDriver
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Handles movement of all bullets on gameboard. Moves bullets by submitting requests to GameController. Delay between moves is common for all bullets, but every bullet keeps its own time of last move. Necessary to run in its own thread.

    • Constructor Summary

      BulletDriver​(int bulletDelay, GameController gameController, GameBoard gb)
      BulletDriver constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BulletDriver

        public BulletDriver​(int bulletDelay,
                    GameController gameController,
                    GameBoard gb)
        BulletDriver constructor.
        Parameters:
        bulletDelay - Dictates the delay between each bullet movement. Every added bullet keeps its own last move time.

    • Method Detail

      • setShouldRun

        public void setShouldRun​(boolean shouldRun)
        Sets whether this should be running. If not, thread finishes.
        Parameters:
        shouldRun - set to true with initial call of run method. False will stop execution.

      • setPaused

        public void setPaused​(boolean paused)
        Pauses execution until further notice. Must be unpaused, or it will stay running but not submitting any moves.

      • addBullet

        public void addBullet​(Bullet b)
        Adds bullet bulletsToMove. Is thread safe.

      • run

        public void run()
        Run BulletDriver.

        Starts execution of bullet movements. It is necessary to run BulletDriver in its own thread, and it is recommended to start it up during game setup. Empty queue of bullets will not cause errors.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
